definition: to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.chinese: 是一个小玻璃容器被砸破。

sentences.english: If you play ball in the house, you will break something.
sentences.chinese: 你要在房子里玩球，会砸破东西的。

sentences.english: The demonstrators broke windows and set fire.
sentences.chinese: 游行者砸破窗玻璃，还放了火。

sentences.english: The printers and distributors of the magazine had their windows smashed.
sentences.chinese: 杂志印刷商和分销商家的窗户都被人砸破了。

sentences.english: He found a rock and broke the vat.
sentences.chinese: 他找来一块石头，用力砸破水缸。

sentences.english: Soapy took a cobblestone and dashed it through the glass.
sentences.chinese: 他拣起一块石子扔过去，砸破了橱窗玻璃。

sentences.english: They broke the windows out to escape from the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他们把窗户往外砸破，安全逃出了大火。

sentences.english: Refrigerator or a piece of heavy furniture could come crashing through the floor.
sentences.chinese: 冰箱或沉重的家具能砸破地板。

sentences.english: Smash-and-grabs when stuck in traffic are not uncommon.
sentences.chinese: 交通拥堵时砸破车窗抢东西并不少见。

definition: to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
to shatter/to smash/to break into pieces
to fall and smash into pieces
to lift/to pry open/to lever open
same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
